senses.sense_definition: The hypothetical author or source of the parts of the Hebrew Bible (Pentateuch) in which God is referred to as Yahweh.

examples.text: The <w>Yahwist</w> is often distinguished by a vivid and anthropomorphic storytelling style.
Scholars analyze how the <w>Yahwist</w> source contributes to the overall narrative of Genesis.

senses.sense_definition: A follower of the ancient religion of Yahwism.

examples.text: An ancient <w>Yahwist</w> would travel to the temple for major festivals.
The inscription suggests that a devout <w>Yahwist</w> lived in this settlement.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to the worship of Yahweh or the religion of Yahwism.

examples.text: The museum exhibit featured artifacts from the <w>Yahwist</w> period of the Iron Age.
Researchers are investigating early <w>Yahwist</w> practices in the region.
